body:
Does coverall merge the coverage report into one?

I think tap is not working on win because of this test

https://github.com/fastify/fastify/blob/77680ff3de42902718313c404946fe16f8b5e8ff/test/listen.test.js#L215
I'm always in for removing coveralls.

> Does coverall merge the coverage report into one?

I have no idea. I never look at it.

> Does coverall merge the coverage report into one?

Yeah, because we're using the parallel option it amalgamates them into a single report:
https://github.com/fastify/fastify/blob/39661e6ea6ce83c835e383ff2f0531680461d27d/.github/workflows/ci.yml#L82

issue.title: Remove Coveralls (closes #3720)

repository.description: Fast and low overhead web framework, for Node.js

issue.body:
As titled. Resolves #3720.

- [ ] tests and/or benchmarks are included

issue.title: Plugin Migration Tracking

repository.name: workflows
repository.description: Reusable workflows for use in the Fastify organization

issue.body:
Issue to track migration to the reusable workflows, as well as anything extra:

-   Snyk badge can be removed as the dependency-review job does the same thing as Snyk, see https://github.com/fastify/fastify/issues/3883
-   Coveralls badge can be removed as these workflows (and the workflows in the main repo) don't use it, see https://github.com/fastify/fastify/issues/3720

The main blocker to migrating plugins is that the reusable workflows use `npm test` and `npm run lint` to perform testing and linting respectively. Some plugins use `npm run test:ci`, `npm run test:tap`, and `npm run lint:ci`, or some variations of them for their CI testing.

| Plugin                      | Moved to Reusable Workflow                                     | Removed Snyk Badge | Removed Coveralls Badge |
| --------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------ | ----------------------- |
| any-schema-you-like         | https://github.com/fastify/any-schema-you-like/pull/11         | :heavy_check_mark: | :heavy_check_mark:      |
| fastify-accepts             | https://github.com/fastify/fastify-accepts/pull/132            | :heavy_check_mark: | :heavy_check_mark:      |
| fastify-accepts-serializer  | https://github.com/fastify/fastify-accepts-serializer/pull/78  | :heavy_check_mark: | :heavy_check_mark:      |
| fastify-auth                | https://github.com/fastify/fastify-auth/pull/156               | :heavy_check_mark: | :heavy_check_mark:      |

issue.title: ci: migrate to fastify reusable workflow
issue.body:
This PR brings the CI for this repo into line with the [reusable workflows](https://github.com/fastify/workflows/blob/main/.github/workflows/plugins-ci.yml).

-   Snyk badge has been removed as the dependency-review job does the same thing as Snyk, see https://github.com/fastify/fastify/issues/3883
-   Coveralls badge and workflows have been removed as main workflows no longer use it, see https://github.com/fastify/fastify/issues/3720

* (b) The contribution is based upon previous work that, to the best
  of my knowledge, is covered under an appropriate open source
  license and I have the right under that license to submit that
  work with modifications, whether created in whole or in part
  by me, under the same open source license (unless I am
  permitted to submit under a different license), as indicated
  in the file; or

* (c) The contribution was provided directly to me by some other
  person who certified (a), (b) or (c) and I have not modified
  it.

* (d) I understand and agree that this project and the contribution
  are public and that a record of the contribution (including all
  personal information I submit with it, including my sign-off) is
  maintained indefinitely and may be redistributed consistent with
  this project or the open source license(s) involved.
-->

      and the [Code of conduct](https://github.com/fastify/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

issue.title: coverage workflows

repository.name: fastify
repository.description: Fast and low overhead web framework, for Node.js

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have written a descriptive issue title
- [X] I have searched existing issues to ensure the issue has not already been raised


### Issue

I quiete dont understand why we need the coverage workflows. Why do they even run before we run all the tests specific to the node version and os?

Why cant they run parallel to the specific tests?
